Package ch.ffhs.pa.competitionmanager.core

Class DbMonitor

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.ffhs.pa.competitionmanager.core.DbMonitor
  • public class DbMonitor
extends java.lang.Object
    Periodically executes a query on a database to check whether now entries have been added. If so, then it will notify all objects in an internal list. The objects must implement the INotifiable interface. The database query is done by an object that implements IDbPuller and can be given in constructor.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Constructor, but will take only one single object to notify.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DbMonitor

        public DbMonitor​(java.util.List<INotifiable> objectsToNotify,
                 int pullFrequencyInSecs,
                 IDbPuller dbPuller)
        Parameters:
        objectsToNotify - The list containing all objects that will be notified if the content of the database has changed.
        pullFrequencyInSecs - The pull frequency (in seconds) to check if the database has changed.
        dbPuller - An objects that will pull the database and provided methods to check whether the content has changed.

      • DbMonitor

        public DbMonitor​(INotifiable objectToNotify,
                 int pullFrequencyInSecs,
                 IDbPuller dbPuller)
        Constructor, but will take only one single object to notify.
        Parameters:
        objectToNotify - An object to notify.
        pullFrequencyInSecs - The pull frequency (in seconds) to check if the database has changed.
        dbPuller - An objects that will pull the database and provided methods to check whether the content has changed.

      • getObjectsToNotify

        public java.util.List<INotifiable> getObjectsToNotify()
        Get objects to notify as a list.
        Returns:
        The objects to notify in a list.

      • start

        public void start()
        Start monitoring the database. If changes occur, all objects in attribute 'objectsToNotify' will be notified.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop monitoring the database for changes.
